title: ICE: error with disjoint closure returned as impl FnMut

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The following ICE was found migrating [`openvpn-parser`](https://crates.io/crates/openvpn-parser) 0.5.0 to 2021 during the latest crater run: https://crater-reports.s3.amazonaws.com/pr-87190-3/try%23a7a572ce3edd6d476191fbfe92c9c1986e009b34/reg/openvpn-parser-0.5.0/log.txt. Error was in [this closure](https://github.com/rusticata/openvpn-parser/blob/5efae2d828859d802de61c93e0f6fd480cc3e5a7/src/openvpn.rs#L141-L157). cc #87988 which was very similar, but has been fixed. Also found in: * https://github.com/rodolpheche/couchdb-purge - https://crater-reports.s3.amazonaws.com/pr-87190-3/try%23a7a572ce3edd6d476191fbfe92c9c1986e009b34/gh/rodolpheche.couchdb-purge/log.txt ### Code ```Rust #![feature(capture_disjoint_fields)] #[derive(Copy, Clone, PartialEq, Eq)] pub struct Opcode(pub u8); impl Opcode { pub const OP1: Opcode = Opcode(0x1); } pub fn example(msg_type: Opcode) -> impl FnMut(&[u8]) { move |i| match msg_type { Opcode::OP1 => unimplemented!(), } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.56.0-nightly (b03ccace5 2021-08-24) binary: rustc commit-hash: b03ccace573bb91e27625c190a0f7807045a1012 commit-date: 2021-08-24 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.56.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler/rustc_mir_build/src/build/matches/mod.rs:1765:53 ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler/rustc_mir_build/src/build/matches/mod.rs:1765:53 stack backtrace: 0: _rust_begin_unwind 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt 2: core::panicking::panic 3: rustc_mir_build::build::matches::::bind_and_guard_matched_candidate 4: rustc_mir_build::build::matches::::bind_pattern 5: rustc_mir_build::build::scope::::in_scope 6: as core::iter::traits::iterator::Iterator>::fold 7: alloc::vec::source_iter_marker:: for alloc::vec::Vec>::from_iter 8: rustc_mir_build::build::expr::into::::expr_into_dest 9: rustc_mir_build::build::scope::::in_scope 10: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 11: rustc_mir_build::build::expr::into::::expr_into_dest 12: rustc_mir_build::build::scope::::in_scope 13: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 14: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl 19: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 20: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 21: ::mir_built 22: 78: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.56.0-nightly (b03ccace5 2021-08-24) running on x86_64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C split-debuginfo=unpacked -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [mir_built] building MIR for `example::{closure#0}` #1 [unsafety_check_result] unsafety-checking `example::{closure#0}` #2 [unsafety_check_result] unsafety-checking `example` #3 [mir_const] processing MIR for `example` #4 [mir_promoted] processing `example` #5 [mir_borrowck] borrow-checking `example` #6 [type_of] computing type of `example::{opaque#0}` #7 [check_mod_item_types] checking item types in top-level module #8 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack warning: `foo` (lib) generated 1 warning error: could not compile `foo`; 1 warning emitted```
